TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IMergeableAnnotation

Docs.summary: Types used as custom annotations can implement this interface to indicate that an attempt to use multiple annotations with the same name on a given table or column may be possible by merging the multiple annotations into one.
Docs.remarks: Normally there can only be one custom annotation with a given name on a given table or column. If a table or column ends up with multiple annotations, for example, because multiple CLR properties map to the same column, then an exception will be thrown. However, if the annotation type implements this interface, then the two annotations will be checked for compatibility using the method and, if compatible, will be merged into one using the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.Annotations.CompatibilityResult IsCompatibleWith(object other) cil managed
Public Function IsCompatibleWith (other As Object) As CompatibilityResult

Docs.summary: Returns true if this annotation does not conflict with the given annotation such that the two can be combined together using the method.
Docs.returns: A CompatibilityResult indicating whether or not this annotation is compatible with the other.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object MergeWith(object other) cil managed
Public Function MergeWith (other As Object) As Object

Docs.param: The annotation to merge with this one.
Docs.summary: Merges this annotation with the given annotation and returns a new merged annotation. This method is only expected to succeed if returns true.
